ygData.subject: RE: Singing Strategy
ygData.msgSnippet: Not taunting hardly qualifies as lowering their combat effectiveness significantly.  That s like asking a rogue not to pick pockets while fighting.  Taunt is
ygData.messageBody:
Not taunting hardly qualifies as lowering their combat effectiveness
significantly. That's like asking a rogue not to pick pockets while
fighting. Taunt is very specialized to get creatures to attack them instead
of someone else. I've never had to have our SK back out of a fight yet.
He's usually the target for the first 15-30 seconds of a fight but they
always switch to me soon thereafter and no amount of backing out by me has
ever helped unless I do it as soon as they switch to me, which kinda defeats
the purpose. We'll see how the taunting reduction affects this and how they
decide to implement it. The first 'smart ass' comment on my guild list was
that in order to reduce bard taunt, using Verant logic, they would probably
give all bard songs a refresh time of 20 seconds. I wish I could say I was
100% certain that the idea was ridiculous, but it sent a chill down my spine
just to hear it suggested.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
Sent: Wednesday, January 26, 2000 12:17 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Singing Strategy


From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>

*Grin* I have on occasion asked a Paladin/Warrior NOT to taunt (use
one of their specials) for a while. To spread the damage out over
all in the party. And we have had our Shadowknight back out of the fight
entirely so that he will aggro more firmly on me and spread out damage more.

So, yes, I can see asking a warrior not to use his extra attacks for part
of a fight, if it makes the whole more efficient.

>Another point on the idea of backing off or waiting to nuke in the case of
>casters. Because they have limited mana, if a caster nukes in the first
>half of a fight or the second half of the fight it doesn't matter they do
>the same damage and are just as effective damage-wise either way. They
>would be wasting mana if they nuked constantly anyhow. If a bard doesn't
>sing for half the fight its a huge hit to their effectiveness, since there
>is no wasting of mana to deal with. Would anyone seriously ever suggest a
>ranger only dual-wield for part of a fight? Or that a warrior not use his
>extra attacks for part of a fight? Of course not. The main reason to have
>nukers wait is because they have limited mana anyhow and they will avoid
>getting hurt and still do just as much damage by waiting. Bards
>do not have
>this luxury.
>
> Kitasi
